ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Doing the research and going through the motions of thinking about and putting together a business plan.
The course is a fantastic way to learn about entrepreneurial business planning - the instructors walk through the pieces of a business plan.
The frequent and thorough feedback on our business idea is extremely valuable. It is also great to have the key points repeated frequently in lecture (e.g. don't hire cheap rookies, etc).

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Coaching for working effectively in teams

I wish that we were able to not routinely feel like we were re-creating our business plan because we kept needing to change the deliverable - like if we could just be working on the same deliverable for the whole first part of the class. I'm not sure if I ever got to a point of feeling like we were answering all of Maureen and David's comments well.

I'd like to have more interaction with the other teams. Perhaps the opportunity to critique or discuss the roadblocks, questions, or concerns that each has would provide extra insight for all the teams.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes, the weekly sections with the instructors were great and regular checkups for the teams, businesses and plans.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The course fits perfectly and is preparation for setting up a social enterprise in a couple of years.
It's a cool experience but not relevant exactly to what I focus on.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It's a great opportunity to work on something outside of my comfort zone.
I am very interested in social enterprises and entrepreneurship.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: The course would be even better if I was working on an plan that I felt more connected to.
yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Emphasizes the importance of working with a cohesive and connected team when setting up a business.
Everyone brings their own ideas to the table and the group work evolves in a cool way.
Working in a group is fundamental to starting a business. I really enjoy working with my group and bouncing ideas off of each other. This course absolutely could not be taught without group work.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Try to find a team and an idea that your passionate about BUT even if you don't find one, the experience of working through the research and thought process with supervision of experts is priceless.

This is my favorite course. Anyone seriously interested in entrepreneurship should try to take it if possible. It often feels like a roller coaster ride, especially if you are pivoting your initial business idea in the beginning. But this is the exciting part, and its very rewarding to evolve your business into something that customers actually want.
